title: Lovely Sunday Lunch
text: Went for a late Sunday lunch and were impressed with both the service and the quality of food both on the traditional lunch and a vegetarian choice.

title: Limited Availability
text:
Although the staff were lovely and coffee good, there was limited availability of food. Pre packed sandwiches and one or two cakes, but it would have been great to have been able to purchase a Welsh cake or a Tregroes waffle, all prepacked and good with a coffee.

A few Welsh offerings are always great for visitors to Wales

title: Smashing Lunch
text:
Who expects to find a great cafe in an exceptional bookshop - certainly worth a visit on both counts.

Everything seemed to be cooked fresh and not reheated

title: Always a Pleasure - so much to see
text:
We always adore a trip to the National Museum in Cardiff - there’s so much to see from dinosaurs to an amazing art collection. We just keep going back time and time again.

Parking can be an expensive problem for busier times.

title: Always a pleasure
text:
Took grandchildren on a dismal Saturday afternoon and as always, it was a real pleasure. We wanted the children to see the new parts in the main building - they loved it.

Restaurant was OK although a few more healthy options, instead of chips, would have been good.
place: St Fagans National Museum of History

title: Great experience - amazing decor!
text:
Had a great experience with a lovely waitress.

The food was good with excellent vegetarian menu.

The ladies loos were something else - worth a visit, just to have a look!

title: Wonderfully surprised!!
text:
Popped in for lunch this week and was surprised at how busy they were for such a dismal day (weatherwise). The place was buzzing.

Lunch was fab and my fellow diner loved the coffee. Service was good with staff being lovely.

Who could ask for more - thank you

title: On the Rocks - ‘Wish You Were Here’
text:
Had a wonderfully relaxing experirence with great food. The views across to Sully Island were amazing especially as night was approaching and it was high tide.

The food was very good, with plenty of choice especially for vegetarians and presentation was good.

Service was great, not rushed, whilst the overall experirence was just excellent.

title: Ticked off my Bucket List
text:
Somewhere I had always wanted to go and I wasn't disappointed.

There were a lot of tourists, as one would expect, but everything ran smoothly.

It's certainly worth pre booking your entry ticket as there were questions.

A lovely morning spent at the Acropolis that will never be forgotten.

title: What an Experience!!!!
text:
We went for lunch before returning to the airport and were com.pletely blown away by both the food, view and the lovely staff.

Lots of good vegetarian choices that were incorporated into the Traditional Greek menu.

We had the best seat in the house and savoured every moment - thank you Mina.

title: Best Ice Cream Ever!
text:
So yummy and such a choice. I thought only I put whipped cream on ice cream, but these guys do too.

Worth a visit - skip pudding in a restaurant and go for these masterpieces.

title: Creative Greek Cuisine
text:
Excellent home made sauces and chutneys to accompany your meal were brought in really cute labelled bottles.

Dinner was superb - the crispy smoked cheese pasta starter was plentiful and soooo tasty. My friend had a dirty Mac & cheese that she also found excellent.

Wine choices good

title: Ticked off my wish list
text:
Certainly worth pre booking your tickets - we booked ours wit the hop on hop off bus tour - saves waiting.

A victim of it’s own success, the Acropolis is certainly worth a visit - couldn’t go to Athens and pass it by,

title: Can only say - AMAZING!
text:
After arriving at our booked hotel, only to find it had bee cancelled (part of the Thomas Cook fiasco) we were advised to book Sir Athens - how glad we were to have such a lovely experience.

Elena, the lovely lady who looked after us, could not have been nicer. We were given excellent tips on where to go, where to eat and everything Athens.

Our room was excellent with a window overlooking the historic courtyard and although the building, itself, was historic, the interiors were modern and beautifully designed and equipped.

Next trip to Athens - guess where we’ll be staying!

title: Absolutely Appalling!!
text:
This used to be a reasonable, budget, restaurant, how times have changed.

It had to be the most disappointing experience for a number of years.

title: Lovely little gem
text:
This is certainly worth a visit.

Good food, lovely staff and a great setting. We were a large party, with children, and we were looked after exceptionally well. Loved the menu.

title: Wonderfully Different
text:
Loved the small plates for Indian food, a big change from mountains of endless rice so common in many restaurants.

Food was well spiced, but not over the top, with a lovely choice including good vegetarian choices and unusual fish dishes.

Really enjoyed the interaction with the barmanwho was able to give recommendations according to individual palates.

Thank you to my friend for this recommendation.

title: Smashing Mother’s Day Sunday Lunch
text:
We had a lovely Sunday Lunch for Mother’s Day with plenty of choice for the kids, vegetarians and traditional lunch.

Staff and service great, especially as they were so busy.

Excellent value for money.

title: Would liked to have spent longer
text:
Loved this place, but could have stayed much longer.

Plenty to see and do as well as shopping (which was expensive). The design factor was breath-taking.

title: Wished we had gone again
text:
Visited the Aquarium on the last night of our stay - big mistake - should have gone at least twice, it was amazing!

So peaceful and interesting. Lovely to see families lying on cushions just soaking up the splendour of another world. Who needs WiFi when you have all of this.

title: Always a Pleasure
text:
Always good to fly Virgin, they know how to look after customers.

Loved the afternoon tea. And lunch was smashing.

Cabin crew were helpful, kind and courteous.

Entertainment was excellent x thank you Virgin.

title: A Rug Shop in Disguise
text:
An extremely disappointing visit I assumed, quite incorrectly, that we were going to see some art, but the group we were with were ushered into a room where the sales patter began.

I have seen this guise many times in various countries, and this was a rug shop that also sold other, over priced, bric a brac upstairs.

Couldn’t wait to get out into the fresh air

Buyer (or visitor) beware!,

title: First & Last Time!
text:
Sadly, our Virgin flight (Premium Economy) to Dubai was cancelled due to technical issues and the lovely Virgin staff got us onto an Emirates flight (Economy) we thought great as they have won a number of awards. How wrong we were.

We were on a A380 plane - Emirates doesn’t have a Premium Economy section so we were herded into a very crowded Economy class.

My husband’s seat was broken and he had to sit bolt upright all night and there was very little leg room.

To compound the trip from hell, there were no vegetarian options on the in flight dinner menu and one was unable to order in advance. A very caring Steward did manage to find a fruit platter for me. How can an airline not have a non meat or fish option on their flight? My husband’s chicken concoction looked and tasted foul and the barley salad starter was equally disgusting.

I think all of the good reviews that Emarites receive are from customers that are fortunate to fly either Business or First Class, certainly not from the overcrowded, cheap seats.

Thank you for getting us to our destination on time Emirates, but we won’t be flying with you again. Take heed future travellers!

title: Lovely Surprise
text:
Had a really good lunch with family. Never been before and was pleases at how good the menu was and, of course, the food.

Great interiors, I am assuming that the pub has recently had a refurb.

Staff were pleasant and helpful, thank you for a lovely Saturday lunch.

title: Astounding!
text:
We decided to go for the VIP experience and were so glad we did. We went to the 148th floor were we enjoyed the luxury of the world’s highest lounge.

What an amazing experience with no queuing for lifts to in and out - certainly worth the extra for this truely amazing experience.

title: Beware of hidden supplements!!!
text:
Saffron was part of our Platinum package at the Atlantis meaning that we did not pay extra or supplements to eat here.

On booking a table, nothing was said, but on going to dinner, staff tried to charge us a supplement. We explained our package, but the staff and management would not concede. Admittedly, it was the week of Chinese New Year, but that was never mentioned.

We were embarrassed and walked away from Saffron.

It was the principle of having to pay more for dinner, that we had already paid for.

Beware of hidden costs!!!

title: Great place to start your holiday
text:
We were pleasantly surprised at this Italian restaurant.

My husband and I shared a yummy pizza, which was just enough after our long trip from the UK.

Staff were lovely, chatting to us and making us feel very comfortable.

title: Amazing Lebanese Restaurant
text:
Hussein Hadla, the restaurant manager, looked after us extremely well during our visit, recommending dishes for us to try.

The food was delightful, with a large vegetarian selection.

It was lovely to eat and be entertained by a belly dancer.

My only comment would be we were spoilt for choice and the portions served were huge - sorry, couldn’t eat all of the delicious food. It was also good to see the food being prepared and cooked.

title: Bit noisy, but excellent food choices
text:
This restaurant was a breath of fresh air. Our waiter, Nuwan, looked after us very well whenever we eat in this particular restaurant.

The food choices and the way in which the food is displayed is phenomenal. There was never any mess from spilt food. I discovered, on one particular evening, that the restaurant had1,300 covers - that takes some doing.

A good recommendation is to eat outside, it is less noisy

You could never go to this restaurant and say that there was nothing you could eat - well done to the chefs and staff.

title: Why Haven’t I Been Before!!
text:
What a brilliant find for those who love fine dining at a good price.

Everthing about Park House shouts elegance and sophistication from the amazing French crockery, to the unbelievable food and the attentive service. The ambiance was chilled and not at all stuffy, just what you need when you want a relaxing meal.

There is a fantastic cocktail bar on the first floor, again elegant and chic without being pretentious

Can’t wait to go back.

title: Well worth going in - beautiful
text:
I popped in at the end of the day and instead of being told “we’re about to close” was given a quick look around.

Certainly worth spending a couple off hours looking at the very diverse artwork - loved it.
place: Oriel y Parc Landscape Gallery and Visitor Centre

title: Lovely little locals pub
text:
Early enjoyed the warm welcome and log fire on a cold and wet January afternoon.

Food was really good - well prepared and presented and plenty of it. Look out for the Specials Board (or screen - ver modern for an old pub).

January - all food half price - a welcome and added bonus!

title: Wow Factor!
text:
What an amazing hotel. Staff absolutely brilliant with nothing too much trouble.

Restaurant fab - food should be Michelin star - again amazing. No problem with dietary requirements.

One of the few art hotels in Wales - the work displayed is magnificent- I just loved it,
place: Blas Restaurant at Twr y Felin Hotel

title: Really Surprised!
text:
Food was really very good and plenty of it - vegetarian choice amazing! It was like eating home cooked food and served in enamel dishes.

A nice chilled, relaxed place that is moderately priced and the staff were lovely.

The whole area seems to be building quite a foodie reputation

title: Christmas Afternoon Tea - yummy!
text:
Amazing Christmas after noon tea, with far too much to eat. Staff kindly supplied a box to take away anything we couldn’t eat. Plenty of choice with novel Santa cakes.

Service amazing, staff extremely attentive and really helpful.

title: Amazing Deli and Great Lunch
text:
Thoroughly enjoy a visit to Ultracomida. Lunch was really good with very reasonably priced wine.

Bought loads in the deli afterwards, well worth a visit

title: A Little Tired
text:
Enjoyed a visit to Bluestone using the Blue Lagoon, but it is looking a little tired now.

I did notice staff wearing outdoor shoes on the pool area - not good.

Kids all seemed to enjoy the pool.

title: Lovely dinner
text: Enjoyed a lovely evening with friends at the Peppercorn - good food, good wine and lovely atmosphere

title: Great for Pre-Theatre Supper
text:
Had a fab dinner before going to the New Theatre for the evening - certainly a good way to start a lovely night out.

Food was excellent, great vegetarian choices as well as choices for meat and fish.

Staff exceptionally attentive - all round a great experience

title: Airline OK - Rhodes Airport Horrendous!
text:
Check in at Cardiff excellent, very efficient with lovely ground staff. Flight also very good although it would have been good to have a meal included with the flight.

Check in at Rhodes was one of the worst airports I have ever experienced even although we had boarding passes it took 2 hours to get to boarder control and the another wait of about an hour.

Once airside Rhodes Airport was unbelievably full, dangerously so with passengers trying to buy food and then having to sit on the floor to eat it! Unbelievable!!

This really spoilt what was an excellent holiday x never going back to Rhodes airport

title: Excellent food - Poor booking System
text:
Enjoyed an excellent meal. A very busy little pub.

Chef has an excellent pallet - you should try his smoked beetroot starter - one of the best I’ve tasted.

All the dishes were beautifully presented on some lovely crockery.

Booking system is not the best, it should be made very clear that the restaurant does not open until 18:45 (although you can eat in the bar)

Staff were lovely - a real hidden gem.

title: Nice family holiday village
text:
Good for families with brilliant entertainment.

The staff were lovely and the food in the main dining area good, but the speciality restaurants left a lot to be desired - in fact they were pretty poor -who has heard of a four cheese pizza with no tomato topping, just cheese!

Rooms were cleane and tidy, worth upgrading.

title: Wow!
text:
Pale Hall is the epitome of style and sophistication. The interiors lavishly beautiful, the food amazing and the service unbelievable.

The grounds lend themselves to some amazing walks, packed lunches are provided if required.

The hotel is more lik a home, it’s like stepping back in time.

title: Etna - Couldn’t Get Much Higher!
text:
What a brilliant experience.

Our guide, Giacomo, is one of the best - his knowledge was astounding. We went on a half day tour, although it was a lengthy half day, and we saw and heard all about the wonders of Etna.

The tour was tailored to the group, which was great, we’re all not hikers or mountain goats. Geology has never been one of my strong subjects, but the tour left me wanting to learn more - thank you.

title: Poor Start - Happy Ending!
text:
Taken to this little restaurant by guide on tour of Palermo.

After slow start, took ages to get served, our lunch arrived in slow stages and waiters got it wrong. I went to see manager and within minutes correct food was brought to our table, plus some lovely hot fresh breads.

Before we left a huge cake stand was brought over with some delicious Sicilian cakes.

We were not charged for the whole meal and went away happy. It really doesn’t pay to get on your high horse but to be patient with people - it’s often a break down in communication.

The food we ate was lovely incidentally.

title: Lovely Family Run Hotel
text:
Having read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I feel as if I was in a different hotel. It was very friendly, clean, spacious and traditional. The views were amazing, we were asked on checking in if we would like a sea view - who wouldn’t!

Breakfasts were great and we even had then in our room when we had an early excursion.

I feel that when travelling overseas, people should consider that it will be different to the UK or the US. There might be a slight language barrier, but that is not always the fault of the hotelier.

Great stay, great people - thank you

title: Absolutely Loved it
text:
What a stunning place. Both the house and the grounds were amazing - a fantastic day out.

The little cafe was busy, but it was worth the wait - soup and a cheesy scone were yummy then off for a good walk around the splendid lake.

title: Smashing Little Place
text:
Nine of us took a chance and went in for lunch - what a lovely surprise. We were met with a smiling face and a very helpful lady.

We all had a good lunch and the children were happy - happy kids, happy day out!

It’s only a very small place, but the welcome was huge

title: Empty but couldn’t get a table!
text: I find it unbelievable, in Carmarthenshire, at the height of the tourist season, why so many restaurants/pubs do not have availability when there is nobody in their restaurant. Sadly, the White Hart was one

title: Absolutely Fabulous!
text:
This was a treat I had wanted to indulge in The Angle’s afternoon tea for a very long time and was certainly not disappointed.

It was decadent, beautiful, satisfying and the service was excellent.

The food was beautifully presented and dietary requirements were observed from the outset - it was good to see that lip-service was not applied to requirements - that you to all the staff.

My only criticism, I could not eat everything, but was given a little box, tied with pink ribbon to take home - how thoughtful, no waste.

title: A Welcome Little Gem
text:
Our first stop in Abergavenny was this hidden gem. Had a great breakfast of sour dough toast with avocado and beet and hummus topping - yummy.

It was good to find a large jug of lemon water - this is not often available in many places.

The decor was simple, but lovely and with WiFi - a must in this day and age.

title: Good lunch, Great service
text:
Pleasantly surprised by the food and service - it was packed on a Tuesday lunch time.

Good vegetarian options as well as meat and fish.

The interior was lovely, very different to how I remembered it.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
Spent a good couple of hours with four children who found plenty to occupy them.

The staff were marvellous and explained things to the children as well as speaking in Welsh to the two older kids (both Welsh speakers).

It’s great to have free entry to somewhere so interesting.

My only complaint was that I spent a fortune on a lovely MelinTregwnt blanket - couldn’t resist it!

title: One hell of a day!
text:
Free entry - always a good way to kick off the day, meaning that the children could be indulged in painting a home for ladybirds. The walks and play areas were fab.

Kids saw water buffalos and many different birds and didn’t complain once about walking - they had such fun.

Lunch was good, busy but still good service.

Well done to the team at the Welsh Wildlife Centre - you have an enviable product.

title: A must when visiting Cardigan
text:
We always head here when on holiday in the area. Fab, freshly made pizzas, lovely atmosphere and great for all ages. They have certainly put Cardigan on the map - we went on a Monday night and it was really busy.

Good tip - if you have family, go early to get a big table either in the tipi by the log fire or outside overlooking the river.

Loads of really big fish in the Teifi to spot - makes a great game for children.

title: Good Sunday Lunch
text:
Great Sunday lunch if you eat meat, but poor vegetarian choice as food not this seasoned as well as it could have been.

The group I was with thoroughly enjoyed their lunch - service was good although they were really short staffed and the lady running the show did an exceptional job as did the cook.

Well done guys, you were really busy!

title: Humble by Name Only
text:
This was our first visit to this lovely little restaurant, and by no means our last!

The food was unpretentious, beautifully presented and served with love. This is one place to which we will return again and again.

Our dining experience was brilliant, it certainly helped with staff able to talk about the food and how it was cooked - I’ve never seen a humble carrot cooked three ways as a starter, truly inspiring for a vegetarian.

The meat dishes were also excellent, my husband ate the belly pork and thought he’d gone to heaven. His highlight was the mash - the trouble chef had gone to for something so simple but also, in many cases, so bland.

A lovely dining experience - thank you.

title: Reasonable Day out
text:
After previously seeing how run down Oakwood was getting, I was pleasantly surprised to see that money had been spent in a transforming the attraction up to a reasonable standard.

Many of the bigger rides were not open, which was disappointing and one could not get a coffee at 10.30 as the staff had only just switched on the coffee machines - lost revenue!

I did feel that the fast track system caused anger amongst people queuing for rides - this set up an elitist, badly organised segregation of punters, who, incidentally, had paid a lot of money in entrance fees.

Staff were pleasant, but the whole set up was lacking in lustre - I do realise that it is not Disney, and never will be, but please - get all of the rides running from opening to closing time and try to cut down on the queues

title: A Foodie’s Paradise in Wales!
text:
From start to finish the taster menu was out of this world.

I ate a vegetarian option and my dining partner had the meat and fish - whow!

Nothing was too much trouble and the flavours were to die for. There are some excellent palates in the kitchen, but none more than chef’s daughter - Georgia. She invents some wonderful pudding combinations which is amazing for one so young.

This family run business is certainly worth a visit if you are staying in or around Cardiff.

The restaurant can be found on the seafront of the pretty Victorian town of Penarth - an excellent backdrop to an excellent restaurant.

title: Fed up with Motorway food - this is Worth a de-tour
text:
We were going to stop at a motorway service station for a break and somthing to eat when we saw a hand written sign for a pub with grub (we actually found out that this was the pub across the road!)

Ended up having Sunday lunch and watched some football with the locals.

What a lovely, friendly place with simple well cooked food. Staff were marvellous.

East Isley is a hidden gem, what a beautiful place.
